alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:18PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Landspouts possible across northeastern Douglas, southwestern Weld, western Arapahoe, eastern Denver and western Adams Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of developing thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near Fort Lupton to Castle Pines, or along a line extending from 22 miles south of Greeley to 16 miles south of Denver. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Eastern Denver, Aurora, Centennial, eastern Highlands Ranch, northeastern Commerce City, Parker, Brighton, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Fort Lupton, Lochbuie, Hudson, Arapahoe Park, Buckley AFB, Barr Lake, northern Castle Pines and Todd Creek. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.
